content: caching status for all storage subsystems that support caching when investigating I/O-related problems. CHPIDS Use QUERY CHPIDS to display all 256 of the machine’s channel paths and their physical status. I/O performance problems can occur if CHPIDs are offline or not available. CPLOAD Use QUERY CPLOAD to display information regarding the last CP IPL. The information that is displayed includes the location of the CP module that was last used, the location of the parm disk, and how CP was started. Chapter 12. Monitoring z/VM and Linux 377 CP Set commands Several CP Set commands are available that can be used to change some performance characteristics of the entire system or of a single user. cp set share command The cp set share command changes the system-resource-access priority for users. Two parameters are available (ABSOLUTE and RELATIVE):  ABSolute nnn% : Specifies that this user is to receive a target minimum of nnn% of the scheduled system resources, which include CPU, storage,
